entry.title: Do You Got Room For One More Troubled Soul?
entry.summary:
Author: KuroNekoFe

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,089Chapters: 12/12Kudos: 207

Summary: In which Jason and Dick became best friends and fell in love before Bruce took Jason in and when Dick was still Robin. But that doesn't mean that love is ever easy. Dick sighs and shakes his head, exasperated. “So who is he?” he asks. “Some newly orphaned kid, like I was?” “His name is Jason Todd,” Bruce tells him. Dizzying awe abruptly replaces Dick's irritability. A spark of hope lights up his chest. His voice is barely above a whisper as he asks, “Jason?”

entry.title: XX, Bunny
entry.summary:
Author: Anonymous

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,332Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 18

Summary: Red X was great with bunnies, Roy said. Knew how to play a bunny’s pleasure like a fiddle. All the Titan-bunnies went to him. The best part? He was always willing to take new bunnies into his den to give them what they needed—to be railed and dominated by a predator during the climax of their heat. And, as everyone knew, bunnies were always in heat. But Red X has a secret that Roy hasn't told Jason about. A secret that would've been nice to know beforehand. X is, under the disguise, Dick Grayson. Jason's predecessor, whose relationship with Jason is more than a little awkward to say the least.

entry.title: The Dynamic Duo
entry.summary:
Author: sarriathmg

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 25,847Chapters: 4/34Kudos: 150

Summary: Having been Batman for four years, Dick Grayson still hasn't gotten used to the heaviness of the cowl. Now, investigating a mass disappearance case that happened a few days ago in a late-night diner, Dick meets a young street rat who's had friends tangled up in the same web. Jason Todd has all the traits Dick saw in himself when he first started—curious, shrewd, agile, and, most importantly, wanting to do good. Despite Dick's initial rejection of the boy, he starts to think that a long-term partnership isn't a bad idea. Perhaps four years have been long enough time for the current stasis. Perhaps, he thinks, it's time for his own Robin.

entry.title: Glass Rain
entry.summary:
Author: soaring_bubblegum

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 219,595Chapters: 47/53Kudos: 1,705

Summary: Jason Todd wakes up in the wrong Gotham.Here, he stayed dead. Here, his death broke his family so completely they became the monsters they once fought. Dick Grayson haunts the skyline with wings and talons, Barbara Gordon moves like a spider made of shadow, and something that might have once been Batman rules from a corrupted cave.The city is quarantined, the air tastes of ozone and old blood, and Jason should be running.Instead, he finds himself drawn to the creature that was once his brother—the one stalking him through twisted streets with eyes that still burn with something almost human.Some hunts, it turns out, go both ways.

entry.title: What It Sounds Like
entry.summary:
Author: UltraCaffeinatedIvy

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 40,778Chapters: 12/14Kudos: 134

Summary: Things are mostly looking up for Jason Todd. He’s finally earned a scholarship to Gotham Academy and has a place that actually feels like home. He knows it's not some kind of cosmic reward for getting through a rough past, living through Catherine's addictions, his dad up and disappearing, or any of the other shit he's had to put up with. You get dealt your hand in life, for better or —more likley— worse, and try to make the best of it. Then Dick Grayson steps in. Or Where Pamela Isley adopts Jason Todd. Enrolls him in Gotham Academy and Jason struggles being a normal teenager, having friends and, of course, falls in love with Dick Grayson in the process. A coming of age story.
